Carn Dearg (Monadhliath)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Carn Dearg is the highest of the Monadhliath, situated on a fairly slender ridge leading south from the main plateau and quite uncharacteristic of the range. It is usually combined with its neighbours further east.

 You have not climbed Carn Dearg (Monadhliath).

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 945 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.07/5
Rating: 3.1/5 (71 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The Monadhliath Munros: a' Chailleach, Carn Sgulain and Carn Dearg from Glen Banchor

Other routes and challenges

Carn Dearg can also be reached along its south ridge over Carn Macoul, although the lower slopes of the latter are relentless steep and act as a deterrent.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kingussie / Newtonmore Hotels

Kingussie / Newtonmore B&B

Kingussie / Newtonmore cottages

Cairngorms hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)

There are 4082 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Carn Dearg (Monadhliath). They have contributed 70 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first.
